summary: DOD uses term and temporary appointments to hire civilian personnel for non-permanent positions that have uncertain funding or workload. (Temporary appointments are generally shorter than term appointments.) DOD recently extended the duration of its term and temporary appointments. Term appointments can now last up to 8 years (versus 4 years), and temporary appointments can last up to 3 years (versus 2 years). However, although DOD...
title: Defense Workforce: DOD Needs to Assess Its Use of Term and Temporary Appointments
